title: [Bug] Elderwood LeBlanc is just Zyra as a LeBlank skin
body:
Elderwood LeBlanc is just Zyra as a LeBlanc skin

That is artistically unacceptable to use another champion as a skin.
Your creative and QA team should not have allowed this to pass.
There are tons of ideas that can be "sexy girl clown magician".
Using artwork that is occupied by the core character of another champ is simply unacceptable.
Please fix.

replies.body:
Hey Eggroll9000  -

This isn't a bug. 

This was an intentional skin, and we felt it was a good thematic for LeBlanc. That said, you're absolutely entitled to your own opinon.

If you'd like to share your thoughts about skins, I would suggest heading over to **[Story, Art and Sound](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art)** or **[Miscellanous](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous)**.

I love the skin, but I actually don't see it as her theme.  Skins are supposed to be things that reflect the champ, this skin doesn't do too much in fulfilling that purpose.  But I really love the skin and I hope there will be one of her included in the next skin group.

@Riot KateyKhaos

For real?? You think these 2 don't overlap thematically?

http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/img/champion/splash/Zyra_0.jpg
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/scale_xlarge/public/upload/elderwood_lb_splash_1920x1080_v2.jpg?itok=CpNGXWXN

If you showed those images to anyone that does not play League, or did not know of this skin, they would tell you they are the same character.

This video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q40IfQbYlSw
Your own design team explains this philosophy from 2:13 - 3:20

This is an error in design. It does not make sense for the identities of the champions to be overlapped by other champions.

This as if you decided to make: "Fox Lady LeBlanc", "Dark Winged Angel LeBlanc", "Ballerina Robot LeBlanc", "Large Robot Fisted LeBlanc". These themes are taken as the core theme of other champions. (Ahri, Morgana, Orianna, Vi in case you didn't figure that out it... but I think you did.)

Even when you use the same theme, people should not confuse the champions. No one is going to confuse Blood Moon Akali with Blood Moon Shen or Bloodstone Lissandra. Those were well done.

Ultimately, the test comes if you show players that didn't know of the LeBlanc skin, show them that splash art, and ask them who they think it is. I'm willing to bet the vast majority will say "Zyra"

Please fix.

I do agree that they have similarities, I don't agree that that overlap. Of course, this is my opinion. Zyra is more earthy plants, as opposed to a more magical approach that Elderwood LeBlanc has. 

Looking at the splash alone, there are two very different sources of power - vines v. a staff. The silhouettes of the champion are different (especially when in game). 

I'm not sure what else I can say in this case; this is a matter of personal tastes and opinions. We're not seeing eye to eye, and in cases of art, that's not uncommon. 

What I can say for sure is that we aren't making changes to this splash, and what's on live is the final product. I do appreciate your feedback and you taking the time to put it out here on the boards.  :)

Riot Katey Khaos hinting at a possible Zyra skin confirmed! :0 lol jk

Seriously tho, I'm a huge fan of yours Katey and i know you sometimes save board comments or discussions about skins or people asking about skins for champs, which you later comeback to when a skin is then released for that champ. So if a new Zyra skin (or a leblanc-themed Zyra skin) comes out I'll be on the lookout for you on the boards lol :)

Keep up the good work ;)

The real question is why do you care there are hundreds of skins you are likely to see this le blanc skin less than ten times over the course of this season. 


Personally I think the skin looks great keep up the good work guys. :D
I actually REALLY love the skin. LMAO. I'm the first to read RIot too. Great job on the skin. :D I love it.

Wow.  You're some kind of jackass aren't you?  While you are entitled to your own opinion, you should keep disrespect toward art to yourself.  

I didn't enjoy the skins for the cards themed ezreal, morde, etc.  But that was my opinion and there are plenty who like it.  It just isn't in my area of enjoyment.  I wasn't a tool about it like you are being.  

Go learn some respect for people...and probably yourself since you find it so easy to disrespect others.

This is a QA problem. The splash art is beautiful. This is not a problem about the how beautifully the artist drew the splash art.
 
Sure, QA checks for functions like buttons, menus, and stability. 
But there is an entire section of the QA test pass that inspects visual elements (At least I hope there is).

Things such as:
* Text should be of the correct size, color, font, alignment. (Inconsistent use of serif / sans serif fonts and font colors all over the client... Fail...)
* Logos, brand images, backgrounds, button text, should follow the same theme.
* Maps, champions, minions, jungle monsters should have a cohesive art style.
* Champions need to thematically maintain their unique brand identity and should not be mistaken as another

None of these are special test cases. This is standard fare for a game whose brand and characters are its biggest asset.

If Apple's QA saw their logo "bite mark" on the left instead of the right, you can be sure it's a serious P1 blocker, no release.
If Microsoft's QA saw their flag was yellow-blue-green-red instead of red-green-blue-yellow, P1 blocker, no release.
If Sanrio's QA saw Hello Kitty's pink was not their exact shade of super cute powder pink, P1 blocker, no release.
If Google Chrome's launch icon could be easily mistaken as Internet Explorer's, P1 blocker, no release.
If Riot's QA saw a LeBlanc artwork that is easily mistaken as Zyra, it should have been a P1 blocker, no release.

Once again, I'm not saying it's ugly, I think it looks great. But even if an artist drew the best splash art ever but it violates your brand identity, it should be a no go.

**This is a QA problem**

Incorrect. QA does not decide which skins should and shouldn't be made, nor the final look. We aren't personally designing the art. While we do advise our team in decisions being made, we do not make the final calls. You are correct in your following statements that we do have test suites that we run on every skin to ensure its functionality. 

In this case, QA did not advise that this should be changed, because we didn't feel it would be confusing. This feedback wasn't something that was prominent in PBE feedback either. 

** If Riot's QA saw a LeBlanc artwork that is easily mistaken as Zyra, it should have been a P1 blocker, no release.**

This is your personal opinion - which you're absolutely entitled to - but the Skins team did not feel that base Zyra and Elderwood LeBlanc would be mistaken for each other. In general, a splash wouldn't block a release (especially when it's implemented v. not missing).
